column4: thanks for your reply, but I mean I donot need the app xscreensave, I prefer to `xlockmore'
do you speak spanish or portuguese by any luck?
my english is so poor, it's a pity
no it's fine -- I was just offering
can you read the post I sent you?
it tells you what file you need to edit to add it as an option for your screensavers
basically, add your screensaver to /usr/share/applications/desktop.en_US.utf8.cache , like the other entries for screensavers in that file
if that doesn't work, maybe you have to use the locale setting of your system instead
like for me, it might be /usr/share/applications/desktop.es_EC.utf8.cache
it is -- it only keeps the file there with your locale setting
